name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the author/maintainer person or organization.

email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the author/maintainer person or organization.

name.title: Name
name.description: The license name used for the recipe.

url.title: Url
url.description: A URL to the license used for the recipe.

name.title: Name
name.description: Recipe name. Make it descriptive and helpful ;)

keywords.title: Keywords
keywords.description: A list of keywords to search the recipe by

maintainers.title: Maintainers
maintainers.description: A list of maintainers for the recipe

home.title: Home
home.description: The URL of this recipe's home page

sources.title: Sources
sources.description: A list of URLs to source code for this project

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: A URL to an SVG or PNG image to be used as an icon

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of what this recipe does

Dependency.title: Dependency
Dependency.description: Configuration to fetch a Recipe or Operator that another Recipe depends on.

name.title: Name
name.description: Workflow name. This name should be unique among all the resources in your resource. Use an alias if this is not the case.

hash.title: Hash
hash.description: The digest hash of the dependency when retrieved from its source. This is locked when the resource dependencies are downloaded.

alias.title: Alias
alias.description: An optional alias to refer to this dependency. Useful if the name is already used somewhere else.

source.title: Source
source.description: URL to a repository where this resource can be found.

DAGInputParameter.title: DAGInputParameter
DAGInputParameter.description: An input parameter used within the DAG.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name is the parameter name. must be unique within a task's inputs.

default.title: Default
default.description: Default value to use for an input parameter if a value was not supplied.

required.title: Required
required.description: Whether this value must be specified in a task argument.

HTTPSource.title: HTTPSource
HTTPSource.description:
HTTPSource

A web HTTP to an FTP server or an API for example.

url.title: Url
url.description: For a HTTP endpoint this can be http://climate.onebuilding.org.

S3Source.title: S3Source
S3Source.description:
S3Source

An S3 bucket artifact Source.

key.title: Key
key.description: The path inside the bucket to source artifacts from.

endpoint.title: Endpoint
endpoint.description: The HTTP endpoint to reach the S3 bucket.

bucket.title: Bucket
bucket.description: The name of the S3 bucket on the host server.

credentials_path.title: Credentials Path
credentials_path.description: Path to the file holding the AccessKey and SecretAccessKey to authenticate to the bucket. Assumes public bucket access if none are specified.

ProjectFolderSource.title: ProjectFolderSource
ProjectFolderSource.description:
Project Folder Source

This is the path to a folder where files and folders can be sourced. In the context
of a desktop run Workflow this folder will correspond to a local folder. In the
context of a workflow run on Pollination this folder will correspond to a Project
scoped folder.

path.title: Path
path.description: For a local filesystem this can be "C:\Users\me\simulations\test". This will correspond to the run specific folder .

DAGInputArtifact.title: DAGInputArtifact
DAGInputArtifact.description: An artifact used within the DAG.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the artifact within the scope of the DAG

description.title: Description
description.description: Optional description for the input artifact

default.title: Default
default.description: If no artifact is specified then pull it from this source location.

required.title: Required
required.description: Whether this value must be specified in a task argument.

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.description: A list of parameters the DAG will use as input values

artifacts.title: Artifacts
artifacts.description: A list of artifacts the DAG will use

variable.title: Variable
variable.description: The name of the DAG input variable

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the task to pull output data from

variable.title: Variable
variable.description: The name of the task output variable

variable.title: Variable
variable.description: The name of the looped item variable (use dot notation for nested json values)

DAGTaskParameterArgument.title: DAGTaskParameterArgument
DAGTaskParameterArgument.description:
Input argument for a DAG task.

The name must correspond to an input parameter from the template function the task
refers to.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the argument variable

from.title: From
from.description: The previous task or global workflow variable to pull this argument from

value.title: Value
value.description: The fixed value for this task argument

variable.title: Variable
variable.description: The name of the DAG input variable

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the task to pull output data from

variable.title: Variable
variable.description: The name of the task output variable

DAGTaskArtifactArgument.title: DAGTaskArtifactArgument
DAGTaskArtifactArgument.description:
Input argument for a DAG task.

The name must correspond to an input artifact from the template function the task
refers to.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the argument variable

from.title: From
from.description: The previous task or global workflow variable to pull this argument from

subpath.title: Subpath
subpath.description: Specify this value if your source artifact is a repository and you want to source an artifact from within that directory.

DAGTaskArgument.title: DAGTaskArgument
DAGTaskArgument.description:
DAG task argument.

These arguments should match the inputs from the template referenced in the task.

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.description: A list of input parameters to pass to the task

artifacts.title: Artifacts
artifacts.description: A list of input artifacts to pass to the task

key.title: Key
key.description: The loop control key determines how parameters and artifacts from a looped task can be identified

DAGTaskLoop.title: DAGTaskLoop
DAGTaskLoop.description:
Loop configuration for the task.

This will run the template provided multiple times and in parallel relative to an
input or task parameter which should be a list.

from.title: From
from.description: The task or DAG parameter to loop over (must be iterable).

value.title: Value
value.description: A list of values or JSON objects to loop over.

control.title: Control
control.description: Parameters to control some loop behavior for this task

DAGTaskOutputParameter.title: DAGTaskOutputParameter
DAGTaskOutputParameter.description:
Output parameter for a DAG task.

The name must correspond to an output parameter from the template function the task
refers to.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the output variable

DAGTaskOutputArtifact.title: DAGTaskOutputArtifact
DAGTaskOutputArtifact.description:
Output artifact for a DAG task.

The name must correspond to an output artifact from the template function the task
refers to.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the output variable

path.title: Path
path.description: The path where the artifact should be saved relative to the DAG folder.

DAGTaskOutputs.title: DAGTaskOutputs
DAGTaskOutputs.description: These outputs should match the outputs from the template referenced in the task

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.description: A list of output parameters to expose from the task

artifacts.title: Artifacts
artifacts.description: A list of output artifacts to expose from the task

DAGTask.title: DAGTask
DAGTask.description: The instance of a function template matched with DAG inputs and outputs.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name for this step. It must be unique in DAG.

arguments.title: Arguments
arguments.description: The input arguments for this task

dependencies.title: Dependencies
dependencies.description: Dependencies are name of other DAG steps which this depends on.

loop.title: Loop
loop.description: List of inputs to loop over.

sub_folder.title: Sub Folder
sub_folder.description: A path relative to the current folder context where artifacts should be saved. This is useful when performing a loop or invoking another workflow and wanting to save results in a specific folder.

DAGOutputParameter.title: DAGOutputParameter
DAGOutputParameter.description: A parameter sourced from within the DAG that is exposed as an output.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the output variable

from.title: From
from.description: The task reference to pull this output variable from. Note, this must be an output variable.

DAGOutputArtifact.title: DAGOutputArtifact
DAGOutputArtifact.description: An artifact sourced from within the DAG that is exposed as an output

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the output variable

from.title: From
from.description: The task reference to pull this output variable from. Note, this must be an output variable.

DAGOutputs.title: DAGOutputs
DAGOutputs.description: Artifacts and Parameters exposed by the DAG

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.description: A list of output parameters exposed by this DAG

artifacts.title: Artifacts
artifacts.description: A list of output artifacts exposed by this DAG

DAG.title: DAG
DAG.description: A Directed Acyclic Graph containing a list of tasks.

name.title: Name
name.description: A unique name for this dag.

fail_fast.title: Fail Fast
fail_fast.description: Stop scheduling new steps, as soon as it detects that one of the DAG nodes is failed. Default is True.

tasks.title: Tasks
tasks.description: Tasks are a list of DAG steps

outputs.title: Outputs
outputs.description: Outputs of the DAG that can be used by other DAGs

FunctionParameterIn.title: FunctionParameterIn
FunctionParameterIn.description:
A Function Parameter

Parameter indicate a passed string parameter to a service template with an optional
default value.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name is the parameter name. must be unique within a task's inputs.

default.title: Default
default.description: Default value to use for an input parameter if a value was not supplied.

required.title: Required
required.description: Whether this value must be specified in a task argument.

FunctionArtifact.title: FunctionArtifact
FunctionArtifact.description:
A Function Artifact object

This indicates the path within the function context at which a certain file or folder
(ie: artifact) can be found.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the artifact. Must be unique within a task's inputs / outputs.

path.title: Path
path.description: Path to the artifact relative to the working directory where the command is executed.

FunctionParameterOut.title: FunctionParameterOut
FunctionParameterOut.description:
A Function Artifact object

This indicates the path within the function context at which a certain file or folder
(ie: artifact) can be found.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the artifact. Must be unique within a task's inputs / outputs.

path.title: Path
path.description: Path to the artifact relative to the working directory where the command is executed.

DockerConfig.title: DockerConfig
DockerConfig.description: Operator Configuration to run in a Docker container

image.title: Image
image.description: Docker image name. Must include tag.

registry.title: Registry
registry.description: The container registry URLs that this container should be pulled from. Will default to Dockerhub if none is specified.

workdir.title: Workdir
workdir.description: The working directory the entrypoint command of the container runsin. This is used to determine where to load artifacts when running in the container.

LocalConfig.title: LocalConfig
LocalConfig.description: Operator Configuration to run on a desktop.

Config.title: Config
Config.description:
Operator configuration.

The config is used to schedule functions on a desktop or in other contexts
(ie: Docker).

docker.title: Docker
docker.description: The configuration to use this operator in a docker container

local.title: Local
local.description: The configuration to use this operator locally

name.title: Name
name.description: Function name. Must be unique within an operator.

description.title: Description
description.description: Function description. A short human readable description for this function.

command.title: Command
command.description: Full shell command for this function. Each function accepts only one command. The command will be executed as a shell command in operator. For running several commands after each other use && between the commands or pipe data from one to another using |

config.title: Config
config.description: The operator config to use for this function

BakedRecipe.title: BakedRecipe
BakedRecipe.description:
Baked Recipe.

A Baked Recipe contains all the templates referred to in the DAG within a templates
list.

dependencies.title: Dependencies
dependencies.description: A list of operators and other recipes this recipe depends on.

flow.title: Flow
flow.description: A list of tasks to create a DAG recipe.

templates.title: Templates
templates.description: A list of templates. Templates can be Function or a DAG.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the parameter

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the artifact

source.title: Source
source.description: The source to pull the artifact from

TaskStatus.title: TaskStatus
TaskStatus.description: The Status of a Workflow Task

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of this task. Can be "Running", "Succeeded", "Failed" or "Error"

message.title: Message
message.description: Any message produced by the task. Usually error/debugging hints.

started_at.title: Started At
started_at.description: The time at which the task was started

finished_at.title: Finished At
finished_at.description: The time at which the task was completed

name.title: Name
name.description: A human readable name for the task. Usually defined by the DAG task name but can be extended if the task is part of a loop for example. This name is unique within the boundary of the DAG/Workflow that generated it.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of task this status is for. Can be "function", "dag" or "loop"

template_ref.title: Template Ref
template_ref.description: The name of the template that spawned this task

command.title: Command
command.description: The command used to run this task. Only applies to Function tasks.

inputs.title: Inputs
inputs.description: The inputs used by this task

outputs.title: Outputs
outputs.description: The outputs produced by this task

boundary_id.title: Boundary Id
boundary_id.description: This indicates the task ID of the associated template root             task in which this task belongs to. A DAG task will have the id of the             parent DAG for example.

children.title: Children
children.description: A list of child task IDs

outbound_tasks.title: Outbound Tasks
outbound_tasks.description: A list of the last tasks to ran in the context of this task. In the case of a DAG or a workflow this will be the last task that has been executed. It will remain empty for functions.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of this task. Can be "Running", "Succeeded", "Failed" or "Error"

message.title: Message
message.description: Any message produced by the task. Usually error/debugging hints.

started_at.title: Started At
started_at.description: The time at which the task was started

finished_at.title: Finished At
finished_at.description: The time at which the task was completed

id.title: Id
id.description: The ID of the individual workflow run.

entrypoint.title: Entrypoint
entrypoint.description: The ID of the first task in the workflow

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description:
Queenbee Workflow.

A Workflow is a Baked Recipe with some arguments that will be used to execute the
recipe.

recipe.title: Recipe
recipe.description: The baked recipe to be used by the execution engine to generate a workflow

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: Optional user data as a dictionary. User data is for user reference only and will not be used in the execution of the workflow.
